title.rendered: Play Minecraft Classic for free in the browser: Here’s how

content.rendered:
Minecraft goes retro. Just in time for its tenth birthday, the classic has a surprise in store. We have summarized what you can look forward to here.

Discover the retro version of Minecraft

On May 17, 2019, Minecraft celebrates its tenth birthday and you are part of it. For the anniversary, Mojang’s developers have come up with something very special and are bringing a retro version of the block classic to your browser. Means for you, you have access to the 32 well-tried stones of the early version. The interface and the gameplay also do not differ from the original version – bugs included.

Video: Youtube / Phoenix SC

How to play Minecraft Classic in the browser

To start the game, follow this link in the browser of your choice and off you go. But be aware of how rudimentary the game was back then. Only a few of the current features are available to you. For example, there were no creepers or other opponents back then. The survival mode, underground dungeons, cities or the now very extensive crafting system was not there ten years ago. Of course, the game only really works with a mouse and keyboard, which is why mobile gamers get nothing.

Huge new map for game owners

Mojang has come up with another special feature for the celebration. In the current version, a specially developed anniversary card is waiting for you, which you can discover in the form of an interactive museum. This is available free of charge in the Marketplace for all gamers of the mobile, console and Windows versions. If you prefer to create the new world in the Java version, follow this link instead. In addition to information about the individual versions of the game, the map also gives you a detailed overview of the different building blocks and opponents as well as numerous easter eggs and secrets.

Are you playing Minecraft for the first time? Here are a few tips to get you started.

That’s what the anniversary has in store for you

  • You can play the classic version of Minecraft for free in the browser for the tenth anniversary of the game.
  • You have access to the tried and tested stones.

Do you play Minecraft? Which mode do you like to play the most? Are you also trying the retro version? Tell us in the comments.
